page.title: 12DERBY ROAD COLLEGE.
page.content: The college is situated at the junction of Nottingham Road and Derby Road on the outskirts of Mansfield.It was built over 50 years ago.The original college was built on Chesterfield Road in the early 1930's. The college is a modern building made of concrete slabs and bricks.Pupils go to the college from 16 years and onwards. The students study various subjects from shorthand to mining. Course costs vary from Â£1.95 to Â£3.35 per week. When the college was opened it cost Â£850,000.All vocational students pay 15p at registration. Students seem to enjoy their work at the college.
